conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces are visible, and the view is clearly angled with ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Convincing 3D extrusion with readable corners, floor plane separation, and clean cutaway; minor simplification at some wall junctions/edges.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall footprint and major zones (left service rooms + central open area + stairs + right-side rooms) broadly match, but some internal partitions/room definitions (notably dining/pantry boundaries and kitchen/playroom separation) appear simplified or shifted relative to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen cabinetry/island and a fireplace are present, but most furniture is missing (no clear dining set, living seating, or bathroom fixture detail beyond minimal blocks).

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with good contrast between walls/floor and readable openings; lighting is neutral and does not obscure geometry. Minimal artifacts.

detected_errors.description: Room/partition fidelity appears simplified: dining room and pantry boundaries are not clearly represented as in the 2D plan, and some adjacencies look more open than drawn.
Door and window placements exist but several openings are difficult to confirm against the 2D plan (some likely missing or repositioned).
Most non-kitchen furniture and bathroom fixture details are absent, reducing ability to verify room identities.

summary: A clear true-3D cutaway conversion with solid wall geometry, but with moderate simplification of internal room partitions and limited furniture/detail for strict layout verification.
